stimulusHtml:
The x axis has no label or scale. The y axis is labeled Residuals with a horizontal line representing 0. 

  • There are 11 points plotted below the horizontal axis, one of which is significantly farther to the right than all other points.
  • There are 12 points plotted above the horizontal axis.
  • One point is labeled P. This point is in the middle of the rectangular window horizontally and towards the top vertically.
  • There is only one other point above the point labeled P.
  • There is no apparent pattern to the plotted points.
  • However, more points are located in the middle and on the left than other places.

 

​The students in a precalculus class measured each student’s height and arm span, in centimeters. The students calculated a linear regression y=a+bx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} with heights as the input values and arm spans as the output values. The given residual plot has a point labeled P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} at coordinates 175,23.4{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. What does point P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} indicate in the context?
choicesHtml: ​Because point P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is above the x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis, for the student with a height of 175{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} cm, the model overestimates the actual arm span value by 23.4{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} cm.

​​Because point P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is above the x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis, for the student with a height of 175{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} cm, the model underestimates the actual arm span value by 23.4{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} cm.

Because point P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is above the x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis, for the student with an arm span of 175{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} cm, the model overestimates the actual height value by 23.4{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} cm.

Because point P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is above the x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis, for the student with an arm span of 175{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} cm, the model underestimates the actual height value by 23.4{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} cm.
